_comment: This file contains ONE sample of each data format used in datapool.json. Use these as reference schemas for API development.

notification.title: Trial Ending Soon
notification.message: Your trial expires in 3 days. Upgrade to Premium!

author.name: Imam Ahmed Raza Khan Barelvi
author.bio: Imam Ahmed Raza Khan (1856-1921) was a renowned Islamic scholar, jurist, and reformer from India. He founded the Barelvi movement and wrote over 1000 books on various Islamic subjects. His most famous work is the Quranic translation "Kanz ul Iman".
author.quote: The light of Islam will spread to every corner of the world.

narrator.name: Allama Muhammad Ilyas Qadri
narrator.bio: Allama Muhammad Ilyas Qadri is the founder and spiritual leader of Dawat-e-Islami. He is known for his efforts in Islamic education and spiritual reformation, inspiring millions worldwide through his teachings.
narrator.voiceDescription: Inspiring, clear, and spiritually uplifting with excellent Urdu pronunciation

mood.name: Strengthen Your Iman
mood.description: Strengthen your faith with inspiring Sunni content

book._comment: Universal book format - contains all possible fields. Optional fields may be null or omitted based on context.
book.title: Fiqh Made Easy
book.author: Salih al-Munajjid
book.description: A comprehensive guide to Islamic jurisprudence, covering the fundamental principles and practical applications of Fiqh in daily life.

note.title: Key Point on Wudu
note.content: Remember that the intention (niyyah) is crucial for the validity of wudu. The Prophet (PBUH) said actions are judged by intentions.
note.author: Salih al-Munajjid

review.reviewText: Absolutely amazing content! The narrator's voice is clear and engaging. I learned so much from this audiobook. Highly recommend it to anyone seeking Islamic knowledge.

chapter.title: Introduction to Fiqh
chapter.description: An overview of Islamic jurisprudence and its importance in Muslim life.

searchItem._comment: Search items can be strings for recent searches, trending topics, and popular tags

userSubscription._comment: User's current subscription status and billing info - matches database schema

_field_explanations.chapter.sizeInMB: Float - chapter file size in megabytes
_field_explanations.subscriptionPlan.accentColor: Hex color code for plan theming
_field_explanations.userSubscription.progressPercentage: Float between 0.0 and 1.0 showing subscription period progress
_field_explanations.userSubscription.daysRemaining: Integer - days left in current billing period
_field_explanations.timestamps: ISO 8601 format in production, human-readable in mock data
_field_explanations.imageUrl_fields: Can be null, should be absolute URLs in production
_field_explanations.id_fields: Consistent naming pattern: {type}_{number} or descriptive names

data_variations.books: Books use a unified format with optional fields. Include only relevant fields for each context: basic info for lists, progress for library, download info for offline content, etc.
data_variations.subscriptions: Plans contain pricing, features, and benefits - used in subscription screen and upgrade flows
data_variations.user_subscriptions: Current user subscription status with billing info, progress tracking, and plan details
data_variations.chapters: Individual chapter data with file sizes for download management
data_variations.authors_narrators: Same format used everywhere they appear - in lists, profiles, content details, following screens
data_variations.notifications: Same format in notification list and home notification badge
data_variations.categories: Same format in category list and category detail screens
data_variations.reviews: Individual reviews have same format, review summaries are aggregated data

cross_references.books_to_narrators: book.narrators array contains narrator.id values (for detailed books), book.narrator string for recently played items
cross_references.books_to_author_slugs: book.authorSlug references author.slug for SEO-friendly URLs
cross_references.bookmarks_following: Arrays contain IDs that reference other entities

api_endpoints.book_endpoints: Return only the fields needed for each endpoint - minimize payload size by excluding unnecessary fields
api_endpoints.single_items: Use full book format with all relevant fields for individual book endpoints
api_endpoints.lists: Use basic book fields for list endpoints (id, title, slug, author, coverUrl, rating, duration, categories)
api_endpoints.user_specific: Progress, bookmarks, following, notes are user-specific data requiring authentication
api_endpoints.subscription_endpoints: Plans endpoint returns all available plans with pricing and features
api_endpoints.user_subscription_endpoints: User subscription endpoint returns current subscription status, billing info, and progress data
api_endpoints.chapter_endpoints: Include sizeInMB for download size calculations and storage management
